_root.description: A structured set of questions and their answers. The questions are ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the questionnaire being responded to.
_root.name: QuestionnaireResponse

definition.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
definition.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

definition.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
definition.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
definition.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

definition.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A human language.

definition.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

text._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Narrative Type: A human-readable summary of the resource conveying the essential clinical and business information for the resource.
text._root.name: Narrative

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.
definition.comment: The contents of the html element are an XHTML fragment containing only the basic html formatting elements described in chapters 7-11 and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained stylesheets. The XHTML content SHALL NOT contain a head, a body, external stylesheet references, scripts, forms, base/link/xlink, frames, iframes and objects.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

The narrative SHALL contain only the basic html formatting elements and attributes described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained style attributes
The narrative SHALL have some non-whitespace content

definition.definition: The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The status of a resource narrative.

definition.short: Person who received and recorded the answers
definition.definition: Person who received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireResponse and recorded them in the system.
definition.comment: Mapping a subject's answers to multiple choice options and determining what to put in the textual answer is a matter of interpretation.  Authoring by device would indicate that some portion of the questionnaire had been auto-populated.
definition.requirements: Need to know who interpreted the subject's answers to the questions in the questionnaire, and selected the appropriate options for answers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

author._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Reference Type: A reference from one resource to another.
author._root.name: Reference

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.
definition.comment: This is generally not the same as the Resource.text of the referenced resource.  The purpose is to identify what's being referenced, not to fully describe it.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known
definition.definition: An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.
definition.comment:
When an identifier is provided in place of a reference, any system processing the reference will only be able to resolve the identifier to a reference if it understands the business context in which the identifier is used. Sometimes this is global (e.g. a national identifier) but often it is not. For this reason, none of the useful mechanisms described for working with references (e.g. chaining, includes) are possible, nor should servers be expected to be able resolve the reference. Servers may accept an identifier based reference untouched, resolve it, and/or reject it - see CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.referencePolicy. 

When both an identifier and a literal reference are provided, the literal reference is preferred. Applications processing the resource are allowed - but not required - to check that the identifier matches the literal reference

Applications converting a logical reference to a literal reference may choose to leave the logical reference present, or remove it.

Reference is intended to point to a structure that can potentially be expressed as a FHIR resource, though there is no need for it to exist as an actual FHIR resource instance - except in as much as an application wishes to actual find the target of the reference. The content referred to be the identifier must meet the logical constraints implied by any limitations on what resource types are permitted for the reference.  For example, it would not be legitimate to send the identifier for a drug prescription if the type were Reference(Observation|DiagnosticReport).  One of the use-cases for Reference.identifier is the situation where no FHIR representation exists (where the type is Reference (Any).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL
definition.definition: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.
definition.comment: Using absolute URLs provides a stable scalable approach suitable for a cloud/web context, while using relative/logical references provides a flexible approach suitable for use when trading across closed eco-system boundaries.   Absolute URLs do not need to point to a FHIR RESTful server, though this is the preferred approach. If the URL conforms to the structure "/[type]/[id]" then it should be assumed that the reference is to a FHIR RESTful server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition:
The expected type of the target of the reference. If both Reference.type and Reference.reference are populated and Reference.reference is a FHIR URL, both SHALL be consistent.

The type is the Canonical URL of Resource Definition that is the type this reference refers to. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ e.g. "Patient" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. Absolute URLs are only allowed for logical models (and can only be used in references in logical models, not resources).
definition.comment: This element is used to indicate the type of  the target of the reference. This may be used which ever of the other elements are populated (or not). In some cases, the type of the target may be determined by inspection of the reference (e.g. a RESTful URL) or by resolving the target of the reference; if both the type and a reference is provided, the reference SHALL resolve to a resource of the same type as that specified.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

definition.definition: The date and/or time that this set of answers were last changed.
definition.comment:
May be different from the lastUpdateTime of the resource itself, because that reflects when the data was known to the server, not when the data was captured.

This element is optional to allow for systems that might not know the value, however it SHOULD be populated if possible.
definition.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the information in the questionnaire was collected, to derive the context of the answers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The order, proposal or plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this QuestionnaireResponse.  For example, a ServiceRequest seeking an intake assessment or a decision support recommendation to assess for post-partum depression.
definition.requirements: Supports traceability of responsibility for the action and allows linkage of an action to the recommendations acted upon.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

basedOn._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Reference Type: A reference from one resource to another.
basedOn._root.name: Reference

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.
definition.comment: This is generally not the same as the Resource.text of the referenced resource.  The purpose is to identify what's being referenced, not to fully describe it.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

definition.definition: The Encounter during which this questionnaire response was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
definition.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. A questionnaire that was initiated during an encounter but not fully completed during the encounter would still generally be associated with the encounter.
definition.requirements: Provides context for the information that was captured.  May also affect access control.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

encounter._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Reference Type: A reference from one resource to another.
encounter._root.name: Reference

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.
definition.comment: This is generally not the same as the Resource.text of the referenced resource.  The purpose is to identify what's being referenced, not to fully describe it.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

definition.short: Unique id for this set of answers
definition.definition: A business identifier assigned to a particular completed (or partially completed) questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Used for tracking, registration and other business purposes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.
definition.comment: Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer

item._root.description: A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
The respondent's answer(s) to the question.
definition.comment: The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

item.answer._root.description: The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.
definition.requirements: It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

item.answer.valueAttachment._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Attachment Type: For referring to data content defined in other formats.
item.answer.valueAttachment._root.name: Attachment

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

definition.short: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.
definition.definition: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.
definition.requirements: Processors of the data need to be able to know how to interpret the data.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

mapping.map: ED.2+ED.3/RP.2+RP.3. Note conversion may be needed if old style values are being used

definition.definition: The date that the attachment was first created.
definition.requirements: This is often tracked as an integrity issue for use of the attachment.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.
definition.comment: The base64-encoded data SHALL be expressed in the same character set as the base resource XML or JSON.
definition.requirements: The data needs to able to be transmitted inline.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.
definition.comment: The hash is calculated on the data prior to base64 encoding, if the data is based64 encoded. The hash is not intended to support digital signatures. Where protection against malicious threats a digital signature should be considered, see [Provenance.signature](provenance-definitions.html#Provenance.signature) for mechanism to protect a resource with a digital signature.
definition.requirements: Included so that applications can verify that the contents of a location have not changed due to technical failures (e.g., storage rot, transport glitch, incorrect version).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.
definition.requirements: Users need to be able to choose between the languages in a set of attachments.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A human language.

definition.short: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)
definition.definition: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).
definition.comment: The number of bytes is redundant if the data is provided as a base64binary, but is useful if the data is provided as a url reference.
definition.requirements: Representing the size allows applications to determine whether they should fetch the content automatically in advance, or refuse to fetch it at all.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Label to display in place of the data
definition.definition: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.
definition.requirements: Applications need a label to display to a human user in place of the actual data if the data cannot be rendered or perceived by the viewer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Uri where the data can be found
definition.definition: A location where the data can be accessed.
definition.comment: If both data and url are provided, the url SHALL point to the same content as the data contains. Urls may be relative references or may reference transient locations such as a wrapping envelope using cid: though this has ramifications for using signatures. Relative URLs are interpreted relative to the service url, like a resource reference, rather than relative to the resource itself. If a URL is provided, it SHALL resolve to actual data.
definition.requirements: The data needs to be transmitted by reference.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RP.1+RP.2 - if they refer to a URL (see v2.6)

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

item.answer.valueCoding._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Coding Type: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
item.answer.valueCoding._root.name: Coding

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

definition.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
definition.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
definition.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
definition.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

definition.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
definition.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should reference to some definition that establishes the system clearly and unambiguously.
definition.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
definition.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
definition.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
definition.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

definition.short: Version of the system - if relevant
definition.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
definition.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

item.answer.valueQuantity._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Quantity Type: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.
item.answer.valueQuantity._root.name: Quantity

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.
definition.comment: The preferred system is UCUM, but SNOMED CT can also be used (for customary units) or ISO 4217 for currency.  The context of use may additionally require a code from a particular system.
definition.requirements: Need a computable form of the unit that is fixed across all forms. UCUM provides this for quantities, but SNOMED CT provides many units of interest.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.
definition.requirements: Need a framework for handling measures where the value is <5ug/L or >400mg/L due to the limitations of measuring methodology.
definition.meaningWhenMissing: If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because the comparator modifies the interpretation of the value significantly. If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value

binding.description: How the Quantity should be understood and represented.

definition.short: System that defines coded unit form
definition.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.
definition.requirements: Need to know the system that defines the coded form of the unit.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.
definition.requirements: There are many representations for units of measure and in many contexts, particular representations are fixed and required. I.e. mcg for micrograms.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.
definition.comment: The implicit precision in the value should always be honored. Monetary values have their own rules for handling precision (refer to standard accounting text books).
definition.requirements: Precision is handled implicitly in almost all cases of measurement.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: PQ.value, CO.value, MO.value, IVL.high or IVL.low depending on the value

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

item.answer.valueReference._root.description: Base StructureDefinition for Reference Type: A reference from one resource to another.
item.answer.valueReference._root.name: Reference

definition.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.
definition.comment: This is generally not the same as the Resource.text of the referenced resource.  The purpose is to identify what's being referenced, not to fully describe it.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known
definition.definition: An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.
definition.comment:
When an identifier is provided in place of a reference, any system processing the reference will only be able to resolve the identifier to a reference if it understands the business context in which the identifier is used. Sometimes this is global (e.g. a national identifier) but often it is not. For this reason, none of the useful mechanisms described for working with references (e.g. chaining, includes) are possible, nor should servers be expected to be able resolve the reference. Servers may accept an identifier based reference untouched, resolve it, and/or reject it - see CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.referencePolicy. 

When both an identifier and a literal reference are provided, the literal reference is preferred. Applications processing the resource are allowed - but not required - to check that the identifier matches the literal reference

Applications converting a logical reference to a literal reference may choose to leave the logical reference present, or remove it.

Reference is intended to point to a structure that can potentially be expressed as a FHIR resource, though there is no need for it to exist as an actual FHIR resource instance - except in as much as an application wishes to actual find the target of the reference. The content referred to be the identifier must meet the logical constraints implied by any limitations on what resource types are permitted for the reference.  For example, it would not be legitimate to send the identifier for a drug prescription if the type were Reference(Observation|DiagnosticReport).  One of the use-cases for Reference.identifier is the situation where no FHIR representation exists (where the type is Reference (Any).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL
definition.definition: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.
definition.comment: Using absolute URLs provides a stable scalable approach suitable for a cloud/web context, while using relative/logical references provides a flexible approach suitable for use when trading across closed eco-system boundaries.   Absolute URLs do not need to point to a FHIR RESTful server, though this is the preferred approach. If the URL conforms to the structure "/[type]/[id]" then it should be assumed that the reference is to a FHIR RESTful server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition:
The expected type of the target of the reference. If both Reference.type and Reference.reference are populated and Reference.reference is a FHIR URL, both SHALL be consistent.

The type is the Canonical URL of Resource Definition that is the type this reference refers to. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ e.g. "Patient" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. Absolute URLs are only allowed for logical models (and can only be used in references in logical models, not resources).
definition.comment: This element is used to indicate the type of  the target of the reference. This may be used which ever of the other elements are populated (or not). In some cases, the type of the target may be determined by inspection of the reference (e.g. a RESTful URL) or by resolving the target of the reference; if both the type and a reference is provided, the reference SHALL resolve to a resource of the same type as that specified.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

definition.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
definition.comment: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.
definition.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

definition.definition: A reference to an [ElementDefinition](elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item.
definition.comment:
The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.
definition.requirements: A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.
definition.requirements: Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Pointer to specific item from Questionnaire
definition.definition: The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.
definition.requirements: Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: Name for group or question text
definition.definition: Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.
definition.requirements: Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.definition: A procedure or observation that this questionnaire was performed as part of the execution of.  For example, the surgery a checklist was executed as part of.
definition.comment: Composition of questionnaire responses will be handled by the parent questionnaire having answers that reference the child questionnaire.  For relationships to referrals, and other types of requests, use basedOn.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

partOf._root.name: Reference

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

definition.definition: The Questionnaire that defines and organizes the questions for which answers are being provided.
definition.comment: If a QuestionnaireResponse references a Questionnaire, then the QuestionnaireResponse structure must be consistent with the Questionnaire (i.e. questions must be organized into the same groups, nested questions must still be nested, etc.).
definition.requirements: Needed to allow editing of the questionnaire response in a manner that enforces the constraints of the original form.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.short: The person who answered the questions
definition.definition: The person who answered the questions about the subject.
definition.comment: If not specified, no inference can be made about who provided the data.
definition.requirements: When answering questions about a subject that is minor, incapable of answering or an animal, another human source may answer the questions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

definition.definition: The position of the questionnaire response within its overall lifecycle.
definition.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.
definition.requirements: The information on Questionnaire resources  may possibly be gathered during multiple sessions and altered after considered being finished.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire response.

mapping.map: .statusCode (also whether there's a revisionControlAct - and possibly mood to distinguish "in-progress" from "published)

definition.definition: The subject of the questionnaire response.  This could be a patient, organization, practitioner, device, etc.  This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information.
definition.comment: If the Questionnaire declared a subjectType, the resource pointed to by this element must be an instance of one of the listed types.
definition.requirements: Allows linking the answers to the individual the answers describe.  May also affect access control.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
